item.title: OUTLAWS #3: REYNARD THE FOX
item.description:
At the Bodleian library in Oxford there is an exhibition running about the late-medieval outlaw-anarchist Reynard the Fox. I haven‚Äôt been to the show (yet) but this week I looked it up online. From what I can tell, the Oxford retelling of Reynard‚Äôs story appears to be aimed towards children‚Ä¶

item.title: Unplanned Vacancies
item.description:
You may or may not know what the term ‚Äúparking minimums‚Äù refers to. (Though if you‚Äôre reading this, there‚Äôs a decent chance you do.) It‚Äôs a shorthand for regulations‚Äîmaybe not in the zoning code per se, but part of the overall land-use regime‚Äîthat mandate a certain number of parking spaces for a home, or, for commercial or retail space, a certain number‚Ä¶

URL: https://thedeletedscenes.substack.com/p/unplanned-vacancies?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: Optimal Control & √æe Optimistic Inflation Forecasts from √æe Bond Market, &

item.title: Dan Rose
item.description:
Dan Rose on Twitter

‚ÄúI was at Amzn early ‚Äô00s when we lost 95% of our market cap. Later at FB I negotiated a down-round in ‚Äò09, and then in ‚Äô12 our stock dropped 50% post-IPO. I was on the board of a public company that went bankrupt (Borders) and a start-up that went under (Hello). Some lessons:‚Äù

URL: https://twitter.com/DanRose999/status/1522002704121225216

source: Best of Twitter - Week of May 2, 2022

item.title: Trenton Bricken
item.description:
Trenton Bricken on Twitter

‚Äú‚ÄúThe cortex (GM + WM, everything outside the striatum) has ~15 B neurons and ~60 B glia; that‚Äôs ~80% of the brain‚Äôs mass and ~20% of the brain‚Äôs neurons. The cerebellum has ~70 B neurons and ~15 B glia; that‚Äôs ~10% of the mass and ~80% of the neurons.‚Äú https://t.co/Yz9usvRrTb‚Äù

URL: https://twitter.com/TrentonBricken/status/1520032646428082176

source: Best of Twitter - Week of May 2, 2022

item.title: Trenton Bricken
item.description:
Trenton Bricken on Twitter

‚ÄúOnly ~500k neurons in the brain produce dopamine. Serotonin is produced by ~100k neurons in the brainstem. Serotonergic neurons project so widely that virtually every neuron in the brain may be contacted by a serotonergic fiber.‚Äù

URL: https://twitter.com/TrentonBricken/status/1520033416980402177

source: Best of Twitter - Week of May 2, 2022

item.description:

item.title: nathanculley.eth
item.description:
nathanculley.eth on Twitter

‚ÄúI‚Äôve been a first responder for ~6 years, most spent riding an ambulance. I figured going into it that I‚Äôd have some unique takeaways from the experience, but I didn‚Äôt anticipate this understanding of how hard life can be for the less intelligent. https://t.co/2KFPfjgDBW‚Äù

URL: https://twitter.com/_NathanCulley_/status/1521927810809569281

source: Best of Twitter - Week of May 2, 2022

item.title: Marc Andreessen
item.description:
Marc Andreessen on Twitter

‚ÄúOverheard in Silicon Valley: ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve had decades of preference falsification in corporate America. Turns out when Elon stands up and says ‚Äòthis is absurd‚Äô a lot of people have courage to do the same.‚Äù‚Äù

URL: https://twitter.com/pmarca/status/1519441880852828161

source: Best of Twitter - Week of May 2, 2022

item.title: Emmett Shear
item.description:
Emmett Shear on Twitter

‚Äú@paulg @SamoBurja If Twitter is like email, then no successor is coming. We are still stuck w email decades later. If Twitter is like Facebook, then yes. Instagram; TikTok; there will be another. So which is Twitter? Hard to say, but managed right I think good chance it‚Äôs a protocol.‚Äù

URL: https://twitter.com/eshear/status/1519514960807747584

source: Best of Twitter - Week of May 2, 2022

item.title: Kamil Galeev
item.description:
Kamil Galeev on Twitter

‚ÄúErgo. Economic processes aren‚Äôt neutral power-wise. That‚Äôs a major factor of evolution of power structures. That would also explain why many in power would sabotage economic development. If it‚Äôs too complex for them to administer, it will change power balance not in their favour‚Äù

URL: https://twitter.com/kamilkazani/status/1501385899820691459

source: Best of Twitter - Week of May 2, 2022
